verses.kjv: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valour, and he was the son of an harlot: and Gilead begat Jephthah.
verses.web: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor. He was the son of a prostitute. Gilead became the father of Jephthah.
verses.ct: Jephthah the Gileadite was a powerful warrior, but his mother was a prostitute. His father was Gilead.

verses.kjv: And Gilead’s wife bare him sons; and his wife’s sons grew up, and they thrust out Jephthah, and said unto him, Thou shalt not inherit in our father’s house; for thou art the son of a strange woman.
verses.web: Gilead’s wife bore him sons. When his wife’s sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out and said to him, “You will not inherit in our father’s house, for you are the son of another woman.”
verses.ct: Gilead's wife also gave him sons, and when those sons grew up, they threw Jephthah out. "You won't get any share of our father's inheritance," they told him, "because you're the son of another woman."

verses.kjv: Then Jephthah fled from his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain men to Jephthah, and went out with him.
verses.web: Then Jephthah fled from his brothers and lived in the land of Tob. Outlaws joined up with Jephthah, and they went out with him.
verses.ct: So Jephthah ran away from his brothers and settled in the land of Tob. A band of outlaws gathered around him, and he became their leader.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in process of time, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel.
verses.web: After a while, the children of Ammon made war against Israel.
verses.ct: Some time later, the Ammonites went to war against Israel.

verses.kjv: And it was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to fetch Jephthah out of the land of Tob:
verses.web: When the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to get Jephthah out of the land of Tob.
verses.ct: When the Ammonites attacked, the elders of Gilead went to the land of Tob to bring Jephthah back.

verses.kjv: And they said unto Jephthah, Come, and be our captain, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.
verses.web: They said to Jephthah, “Come and be our chief, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.”
verses.ct: "Come be our commander," they said, "so we can fight the Ammonites."

verses.kjv: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, Did not ye hate me, and expel me out of my father’s house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?
verses.web: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “Didn’t you hate me, and drive me out of my father’s house? Why have you come to me now when you are in distress?”
verses.ct: Jephthah shot back, "Didn't you hate me? Didn't you throw me out of my father's house? So why are you coming to me now that you're in trouble?"

verses.kjv: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, Therefore we turn again to thee now, that thou mayest go with us, and fight against the children of Ammon, and be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
verses.web: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “Therefore we have turned again to you now, that you may go with us and fight with the children of Ammon. You will be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
verses.ct: The elders of Gilead replied, "That's exactly why we've come back to you. Come with us and fight the Ammonites, and you'll be the leader over everyone in Gilead."

verses.kjv: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, If ye bring me home again to fight against the children of Ammon, and the LORD deliver them before me, shall I be your head?
verses.web: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “If you bring me home again to fight with the children of Ammon, and LORD delivers them before me, will I be your head?”
verses.ct: Jephthah said to the elders, "If you bring me back to fight the Ammonites and the LORD gives me victory over them, will I really be your leader?"

verses.kjv: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, The LORD be witness between us, if we do not so according to thy words.
verses.web: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “LORD will be witness between us. Surely we will do what you say.”
verses.ct: The elders answered, "The LORD is our witness — we will do exactly what you say."

verses.kjv: Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and captain over them: and Jephthah uttered all his words before the LORD in Mizpeh.
verses.web: Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and chief over them. Jephthah spoke all his words before LORD in Mizpah.
verses.ct: So Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him their leader and commander. Jephthah repeated all the terms of the agreement before the LORD at Mizpah.

verses.kjv: And Jephthah sent messengers unto the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What hast thou to do with me, that thou art come against me to fight in my land?
verses.web: Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, “What do you have to do with me, that you have come to me to fight against my land?”
verses.ct: Then Jephthah sent messengers to the king of Ammon, asking, "What do you have against me? Why have you come to attack my land?"

verses.kjv: And the king of the children of Ammon answered unto the messengers of Jephthah, Because Israel took away my land, when they came up out of Egypt, from Arnon even unto Jabbok, and unto Jordan: now therefore restore those lands again peaceably.
verses.web: The king of the children of Ammon answered the messengers of Jephthah, “Because Israel took away my land when he came up out of Egypt, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and to the Jordan. Now therefore restore that territory again peaceably.”
verses.ct: The king of Ammon told Jephthah's messengers, "Because Israel took my land when they came up from Egypt — everything from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River and all the way to the Jordan. Now give it back peacefully."

verses.kjv: And Jephthah sent messengers again unto the king of the children of Ammon:
verses.web: Jephthah sent messengers again to the king of the children of Ammon;
verses.ct: Jephthah sent messengers back to the king of Ammon

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah, Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon:
verses.web: and he said to him, “Jephthah says: Israel didn’t take away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon;
verses.ct: with this reply: "This is what Jephthah says: Israel did not take the land of Moab or the land of Ammon.

verses.kjv: But when Israel came up from Egypt, and walked through the wilderness unto the Red sea, and came to Kadesh;
verses.web: but when they came up from Egypt, and Israel went through the wilderness to the Red Sea, and came to Kadesh,
verses.ct: When Israel came up from Egypt, they traveled through the wilderness to the Red Sea and then on to Kadesh.

verses.kjv: Then Israel sent messengers unto the king of Edom, saying, Let me, I pray thee, pass through thy land: but the king of Edom would not hearken thereto. And in like manner they sent unto the king of Moab: but he would not consent: and Israel abode in Kadesh.
verses.web: then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Please let me pass through your land;’ but the king of Edom didn’t listen. In the same way, he sent to the king of Moab, but he refused; so Israel stayed in Kadesh.
verses.ct: From there, Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, asking, 'Please let us pass through your land.' But the king of Edom refused. They sent the same request to the king of Moab, and he also refused. So Israel stayed at Kadesh.

verses.kjv: Then they went along through the wilderness, and compassed the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, but came not within the border of Moab: for Arnon was the border of Moab.
verses.web: Then they went through the wilderness, and went around the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; but they didn’t come within the border of Moab, for the Arnon was the border of Moab.
verses.ct: Then they traveled through the wilderness, going around the lands of Edom and Moab. They came up along the eastern side of Moab and set up camp on the other side of the Arnon River. They never crossed into Moab's territory, because the Arnon was Moab's border.

verses.kjv: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said unto him, Let us pass, we pray thee, through thy land into my place.
verses.web: Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said to him, ‘Please let us pass through your land to my place.’
verses.ct: Next, Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites who ruled from Heshbon, saying, 'Please let us pass through your land to reach our destination.'

verses.kjv: But Sihon trusted not Israel to pass through his coast: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and pitched in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
verses.web: But Sihon didn’t trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
verses.ct: But Sihon didn't trust Israel to pass through his territory. Instead, he assembled his entire army, set up camp at Jahaz, and attacked Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God of Israel delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they smote them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.
verses.web: LORD, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they struck them. So Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of Israel, handed Sihon and his entire army over to Israel. Israel defeated them and took possession of all the land belonging to the Amorites who lived there.

verses.kjv: And they possessed all the coasts of the Amorites, from Arnon even unto Jabbok, and from the wilderness even unto Jordan.
verses.web: They possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even to the Jordan.
verses.ct: They took control of all the Amorite territory from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River, and from the wilderness to the Jordan.

verses.kjv: So now the LORD God of Israel hath dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and shouldest thou possess it?
verses.web: So now LORD, the God of Israel, has dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and should you possess them?
verses.ct: So it was the LORD, the God of Israel, who drove out the Amorites to make room for his people Israel. And now you think you should have that land?

verses.kjv: Wilt not thou possess that which Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess? So whomsoever the LORD our God shall drive out from before us, them will we possess.
verses.web: Won’t you possess that which Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So whoever LORD our God has dispossessed from before us, them will we possess.
verses.ct: Don't you keep whatever your god Chemosh gives you? In the same way, we will hold on to everything the LORD our God has given us.

verses.kjv: And now art thou any thing better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them,
verses.web: Now are you anything better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them?
verses.ct: Are you really any better than Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever challenge Israel or go to war against them?

verses.kjv: While Israel dwelt in Heshbon and her towns, and in Aroer and her towns, and in all the cities that be along by the coasts of Arnon, three hundred years? why therefore did ye not recover them within that time?
verses.web: Israel lived in Heshbon and its towns, and in Aroer and its towns, and in all the cities that are along the side of the Arnon for three hundred years! Why didn’t you recover them within that time?
verses.ct: Israel has lived in Heshbon and its surrounding towns, in Aroer and its surrounding towns, and in all the cities along the Arnon for 300 years. Why didn't you try to take them back during all that time?

verses.kjv: Wherefore I have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the LORD the Judge be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.
verses.web: Therefore I have not sinned against you, but you do me wrong to war against me. May LORD the Judge be judge today between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.”
verses.ct: I have not sinned against you. You are the one doing wrong by making war against me. Let the LORD, the Judge, decide today between Israel and Ammon."

verses.kjv: Howbeit the king of the children of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah which he sent him.
verses.web: However, the king of the children of Ammon didn’t listen to the words of Jephthah which he sent him.
verses.ct: But the king of Ammon ignored everything Jephthah said.

verses.kjv: Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead, and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over unto the children of Ammon.
verses.web: Then LORD’s Spirit came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpah of Gilead, and from Mizpah of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah. He marched through Gilead and Manasseh, passed through Mizpah of Gilead, and from there advanced against the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And Jephthah vowed a vow unto the LORD, and said, If thou shalt without fail deliver the children of Ammon into mine hands,
verses.web: Jephthah vowed a vow to LORD, and said, “If you will indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand,
verses.ct: Jephthah made a vow to the LORD: "If you truly hand the Ammonites over to me,

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, that whatsoever cometh forth of the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, shall surely be the LORD’s, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering.
verses.web: then it shall be, that whatever comes out of the doors of my house to meet me when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, it shall be LORD’s, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering.”
verses.ct: then whatever comes out the door of my house to greet me when I return victorious — it will belong to the LORD, and I will offer it as a burnt offering."

verses.kjv: So Jephthah passed over unto the children of Ammon to fight against them; and the LORD delivered them into his hands.
verses.web: So Jephthah passed over to the children of Ammon to fight against them; and LORD delivered them into his hand.
verses.ct: Jephthah crossed over to fight the Ammonites, and the LORD handed them over to him.

verses.kjv: And he smote them from Aroer, even till thou come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and unto the plain of the vineyards, with a very great slaughter. Thus the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.
verses.web: He struck them from Aroer until you come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and to Abelcheramim, with a very great slaughter. So the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He struck them down from Aroer all the way to Minnith — 20 cities in all — and as far as Abel-cheramim. It was a devastating defeat, and the Ammonites were crushed before Israel.

verses.kjv: And Jephthah came to Mizpeh unto his house, and, behold, his daughter came out to meet him with timbrels and with dances: and she was his only child; beside her he had neither son nor daughter.
verses.web: Jephthah came to Mizpah to his house; and behold, his daughter came out to meet him with tambourines and with dances. She was his only child. Besides her he had neither son nor daughter.
verses.ct: When Jephthah returned home to Mizpah, there was his daughter coming out to meet him, dancing and playing a tambourine. She was his only child — he had no other sons or daughters.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent his clothes, and said, Alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art one of them that trouble me: for I have opened my mouth unto the LORD, and I cannot go back.
verses.web: When he saw her, he tore his clothes, and said, “Alas, my daughter! You have brought me very low, and you are one of those who trouble me; for I have opened my mouth to LORD, and I can’t go back.”
verses.ct: The moment he saw her, he tore his clothes and cried out, "Oh, my daughter! You've shattered my heart! You've become the source of my greatest grief! I made a vow to the LORD, and I cannot take it back."

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, My father, if thou hast opened thy mouth unto the LORD, do to me according to that which hath proceeded out of thy mouth; forasmuch as the LORD hath taken vengeance for thee of thine enemies, even of the children of Ammon.
verses.web: She said to him, “My father, you have opened your mouth to LORD; do to me according to that which has proceeded out of your mouth, because LORD has taken vengeance for you on your enemies, even on the children of Ammon.”
verses.ct: She said to him, "My father, you made a vow to the LORD. Do to me whatever you promised, since the LORD has given you victory over your enemies, the Ammonites."

verses.kjv: And she said unto her father, Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may go up and down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my fellows.
verses.web: Then she said to her father, “Let this thing be done for me. Leave me alone two months, that I may depart and go down on the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.”
verses.ct: Then she asked her father, "Just do this one thing for me: give me 2 months to roam the hills and weep with my friends, because I will never marry."

verses.kjv: And he said, Go. And he sent her away for two months: and she went with her companions, and bewailed her virginity upon the mountains.
verses.web: He said, “Go.” He sent her away for two months; and she departed, she and her companions, and mourned her virginity on the mountains.
verses.ct: "Go," he said. He sent her away for 2 months, and she went into the hills with her friends and mourned that she would never marry.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of two months, that she returned unto her father, who did with her according to his vow which he had vowed: and she knew no man. And it was a custom in Israel,
verses.web: At the end of two months, she returned to her father, who did with her according to his vow which he had vowed. She was a virgin. It became a custom in Israel
verses.ct: At the end of 2 months, she returned to her father, and he did to her what he had vowed. She had never been with a man. From this came a tradition in Israel:

verses.kjv: That the daughters of Israel went yearly to lament the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.
verses.web: that the daughters of Israel went yearly to celebrate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.
verses.ct: Every year, the young women of Israel would go out for 4 days to honor the memory of Jephthah the Gileadite's daughter.
